de.polygonal.ds.mem.MemoryAccess

type
class
implements
de.polygonal.ds.Hashable
subclasses
de.polygonal.ds.mem.BitMemory, de.polygonal.ds.mem.ByteMemory, de.polygonal.ds.mem.DoubleMemory, de.polygonal.ds.mem.FloatMemory, de.polygonal.ds.mem.IntMemory, de.polygonal.ds.mem.ShortMemory

Abstract class that grants read/write access to a chunk of fast "alchemy memory".

Constructor

new(bytes : Int, ?name : String)

Instance Variables

bytes(default,null) : Int

The number of allocated bytes.

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

name : String

offset(default,null) : Int

The memory offset in bytes.

Instance Methods

clear() : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError memory was already deallocated (debug only).
Sets all bytes to 0.

free() : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError memory was already deallocated (debug only).
Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all pointers and instantly releases any memory that was allocated by this accessor.
Invoke this method when the life cycle of this object ends to prevent a memory leak.
This is not optional if MemoryManager.AUTO_RECLAIM_MEMORY is true.

resize(byteSize : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError bytes <= 0 (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError memory was already deallocated (debug only).
Resizes the memory to byteSize bytes.
